key_responsibilities: developing, implementing and successfully advancing the office’s legislative agenda
handling policy portfolio in a fast-paced office
requirements: JD or advanced degree in policy and Maryland ties are a plus

key_responsibilities: managing social media channels
sharpening Congressman’s digital voice
planning and pitching press events and responding to press inquiries
compiling press clips and media monitoring
writing press advisories, releases and speeches
updating website
taking photographs and making compelling graphics and multimedia content
helping to develop and execute overall communication strategies
requirements: ability to work demanding hours in a fast-paced environment
work well with a team and multi-task
have a positive attitude and a sense of humor
Maryland ties, previous congressional or campaign experience, and photography and graphic design skills preferred

key_responsibilities: maintaining the Member’s schedule for the Washington D.C. office
organizing, evaluating and tracking invitations and scheduling requests
coordinating travel arrangements
coordinating/drafting the Member’s personal correspondence
arranging and/or providing surface transportation for the Member in DC
coordinating with staff
other tasks as assigned by the Chief of Staff
requirements: strong organizational, communication, and writing skills
possess the capacity to produce high quality work on short deadlines
demonstrated ability to communicate effectively with colleagues and superiors in a dynamic work environment

key_responsibilities: to serve as a local representative for the member in defined geographic areas
to manage casework within an assigned portfolio
to monitor and update the Member and District Director on district and local issues
requirements: hard-working and dedicated team players, committed to the goals of the office and to improving the lives of the residents of the district

key_responsibilities: compiling daily press clips
monitoring social media
producing graphics and videos
maintaining the website
managing press lists
meticulously proofreading
drafting/fact-checking written materials
including briefing memos, social media posts, press statements, newsletters, and talking points
requirements: able to work long hours in a fast-paced and demanding setting
have the ability to multi-task without sacrificing quality
Spanish fluency, Southern California ties, previous congressional or campaign experience, and photography/videography/graphic design skills preferred

key_responsibilities: a small issue portfolio
responding to constituent mail
overseeing a top-tier 499 program
maintaining organization and records for legislative team
hiring and training interns
requirements: reasonable knowledge of public policy and movement conservative philosophy
a commitment to achievement on Capitol Hill

key_responsibilities: None
requirements: Extensive knowledge of the Department of Homeland Security including, but not limited to: Acquisition and procurement policy and practices, Financial and Information technology management, Departmental workforce

key_responsibilities: assisting constituents with federal casework
assisting the Casework Supervisor with casework outreach, intake and processing
attending community events and conducting casework outreach directly with constituents
meet frequently with constituents and liaise with federal agencies
help organize outreach events for the Congressman’s office
requirements: a positive attitude and the ability to work and set priorities in a fast-paced and challenging environment
strong writing and verbal communications skills
At least one year of experience working for an elected official or community-based organization is strongly preferred
A valid California Driver License and automobile are required

key_responsibilities: plan and execute a proactive and aggressive media and community outreach strategy
requirements: work well in a fast-paced collaborative environment
Texas ties and knowledge of TX media and political landscape are a plus and management experience is preferred

office: Senior Democratic House member and Committee Ranking Member
key_responsibilities: developing policy and legislative initiatives and advising Member on all legislative issues
managing long-term and short-term legislative planning
monitoring legislative activity on the House floor
supervising all legislative staff in the personal office
ensuring effective coordination between the personal office and committee office
assisting with hearing preparation as needed
managing health policy portfolio
requirements: proven track record of developing and advancing legislation
excellent oral and written communication skills
ability to quickly analyze and summarize complex legislative details
Advanced degree and extensive experience on Capitol Hill are required

office: Committee on Natural Resources’ Subcommittee on Oversight and Investigations
key_responsibilities: staffing Subcommittee hearings as well as some Full Committee hearings
sending and receiving Subcommittee correspondence to and from the Executive Branch as well as with outside organizations
managing the Subcommittee’s administrative needs
requirements: desire to learn how to conduct congressional oversight and investigations
Prior Hill experience preferred, but not required

key_responsibilities: None
requirements: minimum of three years of Hill experience
Excellent written and oral communication skills required

office: Committee on Oversight and Government Reform
key_responsibilities: depositions
transcribed interviews
briefings
congressional hearings
requirements: junior attorney (fewer than five years of experience)
background or strong interest in investigations
possess excellent written and oral communication skills
